cyclone.name: BARRY
cyclone.current_location: about 170 miles ESE of the mouth of the Mississippi River
cyclone.trajectory: moving west-southwest, forecast to turn west Thursday, then west-northwest and northwest and approach the central Louisiana coast this weekend
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: central Louisiana coast (near Morgan City, LA)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical-storm watch from the Mouth of the Mississippi River to Morgan City, LA; Storm-surge watch Mouth of the Pearl River to Morgan City, LA
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Central U.S. Gulf Coast from the upper Texas coast eastward to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible at Texas City Saturday into early Sunday
weather_observation.storm_surge: Minor surge of 1–2 ft possible along the upper Texas coast, including Galveston Bay
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–6 inches of rain possible as outer rain-bands sweep across southeast Texas
weather_observation.other_hazards: Localized coastal flooding and temporary channel restrictions could disrupt port operations
